commit.message:
configure.in (alpha interix): Use symbolic names to set target_cpu_default.

        * configure.in (alpha interix): Use symbolic names to set
        target_cpu_default.
        * configure: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r26460

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+Wed Apr 14 19:57:49 1999  Jeffrey A Law  (law@cygnus.com)
+
+	* configure.in (alpha interix): Use symbolic names to set
+	target_cpu_default.
+	* configure: Rebuilt.
+
 Wed Apr 14 19:42:02 1999  Donn Terry (donn@interix.com)
 
 	* alpha/lib1funcs.asm: New file.

@@ -2930,11 +2930,10 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		tm_file="${tm_file} alpha/alpha32.h interix.h alpha/alpha-interix.h"
 
 		# GAS + IEEE_CONFORMANT+IEEE (no inexact);
-		#  see alpha.h for bitmasks
-		#target_cpu_default=$((4+8+16))
+		#target_cpu_default="MASK_GAS|MASK_IEEE_CONFORMANT|MASK_IEEE"
 
-		# GAS + IEEE_CONFORMANT; see alpha.h for bitmasks
-		target_cpu_default=$((4+8))
+		# GAS + IEEE_CONFORMANT
+		target_cpu_default="MASK_GAS|MASK_IEEE_CONFORMANT"
 
 		xm_file="alpha/xm-alpha-interix.h xm-interix.h"
 		xmake_file="x-interix alpha/t-pe"
@@ -4874,8 +4873,6 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 	mipstx39-*-elf*)
 		tm_file="mips/r3900.h mips/elf.h mips/abi64.h"
 		tmake_file=mips/t-r3900
-		# FIXME mips-elf should be fixed to use crtstuff.
-		use_collect2=yes
 		;;
 	mips-*-*)				# Default MIPS RISC-OS 4.0.
 		if test x$stabs = xyes; then
@@ -5960,15 +5957,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5964: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:5961: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5972 "configure"
+#line 5969 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5979,7 +5976,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5983: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5980: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6002,12 +5999,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6006: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6003: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6011 "configure"
+#line 6008 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6056,7 +6053,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6060: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6057: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6077,21 +6074,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6081: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6078: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6088 "configure"
+#line 6085 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6095: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6092: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6117,12 +6114,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6121: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6118: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6126 "configure"
+#line 6123 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6150,12 +6147,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6154: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6151: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6159 "configure"
+#line 6156 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6185,19 +6182,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6189: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6186: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6194 "configure"
+#line 6191 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6201: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6198: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6218,12 +6215,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6222: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6219: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6227 "configure"
+#line 6224 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6251,7 +6248,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6255: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6252: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6283,12 +6280,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6287: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6284: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6292 "configure"
+#line 6289 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -6313,12 +6310,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6317: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6314: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6322 "configure"
+#line 6319 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6341,7 +6338,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6345: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6342: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6368,15 +6365,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6372: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6369: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6380 "configure"
+#line 6377 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -6395,7 +6392,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6399: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:6396: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -6420,17 +6417,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6424: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6421: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6429 "configure"
+#line 6426 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6434: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6431: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6459,12 +6456,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6463: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6460: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6468 "configure"
+#line 6465 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6487,7 +6484,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6491: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6488: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6512,15 +6509,15 @@ fi
 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6516: checking for working mmap" >&5
+echo "configure:6513: checking for working mmap" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6524 "configure"
+#line 6521 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Thanks to Mike Haertel and Jim Avera for this test.
@@ -6660,7 +6657,7 @@ main()
 }
 
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6664: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:6661: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=yes
 else
@@ -6688,17 +6685,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6692: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6689: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6697 "configure"
+#line 6694 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6702: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6699: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6728,12 +6725,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6732: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6729: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6737 "configure"
+#line 6734 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6756,7 +6753,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6760: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6757: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6785,12 +6782,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6789: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6786: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6794 "configure"
+#line 6791 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6813,7 +6810,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6817: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6814: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6847,19 +6844,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6851: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:6848: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6856 "configure"
+#line 6853 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6863: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6860: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -6880,7 +6877,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6884: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:6881: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -6900,7 +6897,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6904: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:6901: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -6919,17 +6916,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6923: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6920: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6928 "configure"
+#line 6925 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6933: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6930: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6946,19 +6943,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6950: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:6947: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6955 "configure"
+#line 6952 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6962: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6959: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gettext_libc=yes
 else
@@ -6974,15 +6971,15 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6978: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:6975: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'bindtextdomain | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6986 "configure"
+#line 6983 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6993,7 +6990,7 @@ int main() {
 bindtextdomain()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6997: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6994: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
